climbs.name: Thumb's Up
climbs.fa: Tyler Dziedzina maybe? but perhaps done before

content.description: Start matched on a crimp, then move up to the thumb-shaped crystal, slap a sloper, and top out on easy ground. This is harder than it looks....
content.location: It is on the west side of the formation.

content.description: The Staircase is a decent warm-up on big, positive holds. It is kind of loose but not alarmingly loose.
content.location:
Right in front of

Autumn's Traverse

, it's the blocky face that looks like a steep staircase.

content.description: Trailside Offwidth is a short but splitter offwidth to squeeze. You get bonus points for starting as low as possible. This one is surprisingly sharp.
content.location:
About 100 yards west of Autumn's Traverse, right off the bike trail, you can't really miss it.

GPS coordinates are: 39.336946, -105.267495.

content.description: Schoolroom Crack climbs a nice, little beginner crack on a boulder using hands.
content.location: It is on the east side of the formation.

content.description: Start on a crescent-shaped flake, move up on bad, non-positive holds with funky and balancy movement, then finish off with some slab moves to the top. This is a really cool route.
content.location: It is on the right side of Autumn's Traverse Boulder.

content.description: A nice, sharp, crimpy rail with some fingerlocks leads to a big ol' jug and some scary, slabby moves to top out. There are not a lot of foot holds on this one near the beginning.
content.location:
It is right off the mountain biking trail past "

Outrageous Fun

."

content.description: Stand start in the fingercrack, move up to a hand jam, and top out.
content.location:
Follow the main road for a quarter mile or so, then keep your eyes peeled to the right for a lonely finger crack near the mountain bike trail. It is pretty close to

Autumn's Traverse

. The GPS coordinates are: 39.3382370, -105.2667060.

content.description: This boulder is tough! It has big moves between tough, flaring fingerlocks and horrible feet until you reach the thank-God handjam at the top. Tape up your digits, because this crack bites. Sit start on flared jams with shit for footholds.
content.location:
Follow the main road for a quarter mile or so, then keep your eyes peeled to the right for a lonely finger crack near the mountain bike trail. It is pretty close to

Autumn's Traverse

. The GPS coordinates are: 39.3382370, -105.2667060.

climbs.name: Crystals Are A Girls Best Friend

content.description:
This is a fun, short problem located on the boulder opposite from

Autumns Traverse

. Sit start from two low hand jams. One has a fun, little crystal in the middle (hence the name).
content.location:
It is on the right side of the boulder opposite from

Autumns Traverse

.

content.description: Baby Yoda is a nice, splitter, offwidth roof problem that would get 4 stars if it wasn't so lowball and mossy. Sit start, and kick into the roof, then wrestle your way over the lip.
content.location:
It is the analog crack to "

Trailside Offwidth

."

content.description:
Link

Autumn's Traverse

into

Right Face

.
content.location: It is on Autumn's Traverse Boulder.

climbs.name: Autumn's Traverse
climbs.fa: FKA Tyler Dziedzina, Ellie Moffat, Autumn the German Shepard

content.description: Autumn's Traverse is a really classic, balancy, crimpy traverse! Start on two big jugs on the left side, move right until the features disappear and you are forced to go up to a sloper, and jump off. This makes a great warm-up for the finger crack boulders.
content.protection: Pads and maybe a spotter for the end if you want it. The landing is mostly flat.

content.description:
This climbs the left arete of

Autumn's Traverse

. It is a bit dirty up top.
content.location: It is on the Autumn's Traverse Boulder.
